block_comment: This block assigns the value to the `fifo_11_mux` based on specific conditions associated with valid signals and write pointer values. When write pointer equals to `4'd11` and `itm_valid`, `atm_valid`, and `dtm_valid` are high, it assigns `itm`, `overflow_pending_atm`, and `overflow_pending_dtm` respectively. Furthermore, when `fifo_wrptr_plus1` equals `4'd11` and `ge2_free & itm_valid & atm_valid`, `ge2_free & itm_valid & dtm_valid` and `ge2_free & atm_valid & dtm_valid` are true, it assigns `overflow_pending_atm` and `overflow_pending_dtm`. As a default case, it assigns `overflow_pending_dtm`.
